description.value: An unordered set of distinct values that are time quantities. It is an abstract type and it is used to specifying the timing of events and actions and the cyclical validity-patterns that may exist for certain kinds of information: e.g. Twice a day from January 2017 to March 2017, excluding Saturday and Sunday. A working GTS is specified as an expression tree built using a combination of operator and components (e.g. intervals, point in times, event related periodic interval, and so on).

definition.value: A quantity specifying a point on the axis of natural time. It might be a complete or a partial date (e.g. just year or year + month). It may indicate the time zone.

human.value: Any implementable specification SHALL describe how this abstract pattern is realized (e.g. combination of intervals and event related times).
No members of the GTS set SHALL be valued with null or exceptional values (e.g. nullFlavors).
